fr:mainmatter.fr:p: By the universal property of right Kan extensions, the right Kan extension of F along 1_C is F itself. Since this diagram is preserved by all functors, we conclude that this extension is pointwise, in which case (noting that c\downarrow 1_C = c/C) it is computed by the limit formula Fc\cong \operatorname *{lim}(c/C\xrightarrow {\Pi } C\xrightarrow {F} D). Now the result follows by the construction of limits from equalizers and products.

By the universal property of right Kan extensions, the right Kan extension of F along 1_C is F itself. Since this diagram is preserved by all functors, we conclude that this extension is pointwise, in which case (noting that c\downarrow 1_C = c/C) it is computed by the limit formula Fc\cong \operatorname *{lim}(c/C\xrightarrow {\Pi } C\xrightarrow {F} D). Now the result follows by the construction of limits from equalizers and products.
